edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.interpreter.instructions
Class Instruction.TRAP

java.lang.Object
  edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.interpreter.instructions.Instruction.TRAP
All Implemented Interfaces:
Instruction
Enclosing interface:
Instruction
public static class Instruction.TRAP
extends java.lang.Object
implements Instruction

The TRAP instruction allows the programmer to call the OS for access to I/O functionality. Its syntax is 1111xxxxvvvvvvvv, where x means "don't care" and v is the 8-bit trap vector. There are 7 supported trap vectors:

  • 0x21: OUT - Prints the value of register 0 as an ASCII character. If the high 9 bits are not all 0, a warning is posted, but they are ignored in any case.
  • 0x22: PUTS - Prints a null-terminated string starting at the address in register 0. If any of the high 9 bits of any of the words are nonzero, they are ignored, but no warning is printed.
  • 0x23: IN - Prints the prompt "Enter a character: ", and waits for a character to be entered. The result is stored in register 0.
  • 0x25: HALT - Ends instruction interpretation, and prints a message recording how many instructions were interpreted.
  • 0x31: OUTN - Prints the value of register 0 as a decimal number.
  • 0x33: INN - Prints the prompt "Enter a number: ", and waits for a number to be entered. Program execution will not continue until a complete number is entered. The result is stored in register 0.
  • 0x43: RND - Sets register 0 to a random number with the full range of a 16-bit value.
If a trap vector other than these 7 is encountered, an error (Warning 400) is printed.
